about_the_game:
In the winter of 1997, photographer Charlotte Gray ventures into the remote woods of southwest Alaska, to the derelict logging camp at Deer Creek, in order to complete her project 'Abandoned Alaska.'

Having photographed ghost towns throughout the Midwest, Charlotte expects to find the worn remains of a piece of American labor history, but what she finds is a place that seems to be eerily frozen in time, harboring numerous secrets sleeping deep beneath the Alaskan snow.

Bit by bit, she finds fragments from the lives of the people who once lived here. Piecing together the fragments, Charlotte slowly starts to unravel the tragedy that befell Deer Creek and its people.

'The Tragedy at Deer Creek' is a narrative-driven point-and-click adventure game that tells a mournful tale of family, loss, and loyalty, exploring the lengths we are willing to go to protect the ones we love.

Key Features:

  • Explore the abandoned camp at Deer Creek, solve puzzles, and overcome challenges to progress the story
  • Uncover a rich variety of storylines that paint the lives of the people who lived in Deer Creek, their relationships, and secrets
  • Cinematic cutscenes, a haunting soundtrack, and meticulously crafted pixel art create an eerie, immersive experience

Technical Features:

  • Play the game in narrative or puzzle mode—depending if you want challenging puzzles or prefer simpler puzzles in favor of the story
  • An accessible, narrative-driven point-and-click adventure game with an easy-to-understand single-click interface

content_descriptors.notes: Major themes of this game are death, solitude, and loss. Not appropriate for audiences that normally avoid these subjects.

name: The Tragedy at Deer Creek
short_description: Photographer Charlotte Gray travels to Deer Creek to document a long deserted logging camp for her upcoming book ”Abandoned Alaska”. She finds not only a derelict camp, but also a mournful tale of family, love and loyalty hidden beneath the Alaskan snow, in this point-and-click adventure.
